campaign.story:
Come manage a town in the West, they said. It’ll be thrills, spills, and chills, they said. Well, friends, they weren’t wrong. It has been that and more. But boy howdy, the disasters keep popping up! Almost as though someone is out to see your town fail and their town succeed!
The Roll and Write Revolution continues with Wild, Wild West! In this month’s print-and-play game, we are taking you back to a more traditional roll and write experience for 1-6 players. Wild, Wild West uses just 4 six-sided dice, 1 sheet per player, and features simultaneous play - meaning everyone works from the same dice roll. It’s excellent for remote play and playing on tablets! Watch out, though, Wild, Wild West has a few tricks (and traps) up its sleeve.
Wild, Wild West asks you to manage an old Western town with 6 areas of influence. Each turn players will be given dice to distribute around their town but not all of those dice will help you. From bringing in Varmints to luring bandits, it’s a right cow poke in the eye! You can see some big successes, too, though! Just look at all that cash you can grab from selling watered down liquor at twice the price, or filling up a train for a sight-seeing ride! You’ll even have the chance to round up some notorious wanted outlaws and put them behind bars where they belong! Get your head of cattle together, tell those varmints to scram, and let’s have us a good ol' fashioned ho-down!
Classic euro-style game play will force you stay sharp at keeping the disasters from building up too quickly. The trouble you'll find is that, with only so many turns and something going wrong every single turn, you can't do everything well. *Spoiler alert* The only way to succeed is to strategically fail (like falling with style). Pick and choose your battles well and you just may create a thriving boom town, after all. And afterwards, players are encouraged to look back over their town and share stories of their skillful mismanagement of certain areas. Does your town have a lot of high priced hooch and an ineffectual legal system? Do your future residents from the train feel safe knowing the Varmints have been rehomed? What about those outlaws, did you shut them down quickly with swift legal justice?
Download rules here
Below, Benny shows us how to play:
 This month we'd like to draw your attention to Rick and Courtnei Dendy's shop DetashEmporium. They run an interesting craft supply shop out of Gulf Shores, Alabama - lots of horn, bone, wood & resin blanks and even these really cool Old Western style dice and dominoes.
 Benny and I have a passion for gaming and would love to publish these games in a format that is both fulfilling and inexpensive. Offering the files for players to Print and Play (PNP) at home looks to be the perfect way to go! You don't even need a home printer. Since you'll have the PDFs, you can print at work, at a local print shop, or (like I often do) play straight on your iPad, Surface, or other tablet device.

        PNP allows us:
To offer a low entry point into fun games produced on a frequent basis with no extra shipping costs or delays.
The freedom to design wild, wacky, and wonderful ideas regardless of typical commercial viability.
The opportunity to connect creative makers with a passionate community united by similar interests.
Honest and responsive communication.
Delivery immediately following the close of the campaign.
A referral to at least one indie-maker in our community.
More projects just like this every month.
And we’d love to work with you designers out there! If you have a roll and write style game and want to talk about joining the program, please send us an email at rollandwriterevolution@gmail.com
Meet the Team: Benny Sperling (Designer), Gannon Moon (graphic designer), Derik Duley (publisher and developer), and Odin Phong (support and consultant)

updates.update_content:
Hey there rustlers, wranglers, and mayors alike!
We receive frequent requests for updates. So I'm just dropping by to let you know the next Roll and Write Revolution game is LIVE right now! This month, we want you to go Dice Trucking! Come cobble together your ship, grab some cargo, and try to keep it from blowing apart as you zoom across the galaxy. 
Dice Trucking is another more traditional one-sheet-per-player game but asks players to roll their own dice. You'll be rolling for parts, rolling for movement options, plotting a course across the galaxy, paying for cargo, and generally trying to avoid enough hazards to still cross the finish line. !

Hey y'all!
I still have trouble believing how very many of you came out to support this little game. So, thank you, again (you'll probably be thanked every time you hear from me). 

The main reason for this update though is to let you know that ALL of the files in the shared folder have been updated! Knowby fixed that funky typo on the sheet (incorrect wording on the Judge's Bad Stuff), and I made some minor tweaks to (hopefully) make them more clear. In addition, I also responded to Isa's extensive questions in the comments section. I responded separately so that it would sit at the top and be easier to find. For brevity, I did not include his actual questions in my responses but I did try to structure my sentences in such a way as to make the context clear for those of you who haven't followed the discussion.

THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK!!! YOU!!!
Even after Standing Stones did so impressively well, we never would have imagined that FIVE-HUNDRED-SEVEN of you would come along and help us raise $1,650 for a print-and-play. 507!!! I've always been confident that Wild, Wild West is a great game. In fact, it was going to be the 2nd Lagniappe Game if I hadn't run out of time and energy for physical publishing. BUT HOLY COW, HOW WAS THIS SO STUNNINGLY SUCCESSFUL?!

Your continued support has been absolutely stunning. Benny and I have been kind of holding our breathe wondering if this campaign really would surpass the flabbergasting support that Standing Stones received. This weekend I was blown away to see our number of backers pass the number of Kickstarter projects I've backed. It has been quite a humbling journey. Every day I thank God for you all :-)

I currently have my tea and laptop out to go over the latest updates from resident wizards Knowby. Gotta say, this guy has done an incredible job of making this sheet pretty and functional. Can't wait for you to see it!

Thank you so much for making this a stunning day one!
I know we didn't give you much warning about exactly when we would launch but 117 of you showed up, anyway! My schedule was weird this week causing me to launch at 3 AM AND STILL 3 of you snuck in that first 10 minutes :O I cannot say it enough times so I'll just keep saying every time: THANK YOU!

https://buttonshygames.com/products/death-valley

Sunlight glaring through the windshield. Your favorite songs blasting through the speakers. Candy bar wrappers piled next to a warm drink in the cheap plastic cupholder. Your companion riding in the passenger seat, snapping pictures of landmarks as you settle into the hypnotic rhythm of the road. But be careful: this fun road trip could get dangerous as you drive through Death Valley.

Death Valley is a pocket-sized, push-your-luck, tableau building game for 1-2 players, with each traveler striving to assemble the best mix of cards in their Journey and Scrapbook in order to win the game.
Death Valley is 18 cards, packaged in a portable and durable wallet.

Each turn, players will choose whether to assign a card to their Journey, or move cards from their Journey to their Scrapbook. Cards feature stars (points), special abilities (affect the value and position of cards), and some interesting facts about Death Valley.

Each card also has a hazard (Heat, Terrain, Flood or Animals) listed. Having 3 of the same Hazard visible in their tableau will cause the player to bust and lose all the progress in their Journey.
All 4 hazards and their card distribution within the game.
At the end of the game the player with the most stars in their Journey, plus any additional points from card abilities, is the winner.
To set up the game, shuffle all 18 cards and place 1 face-up between the players. On a player’s turn they have 3 choices: add the face-up or face-down card from the top of the deck to their own Journey, or Rest. When a player Rests, they move at least one card from their Journey to their Scrapbook (stacking them into a single pile if they select multiple cards) and shuffle as many of their remaining Journey cards into the deck as they choose.
After the player takes their action for the turn, they check for Hazards among the visible cards in their Journey and Scrapbook. If they have 3 of the same Hazard type showing (3 Flood cards, for example) the player busts: 1 of the Hazard cards is removed from the game and the rest of the player’s Journey cards get shuffled back into the deck.
Once there is only one card remaining in the center area, the game ends. Each player counts up the stars showing in their Journey row. Visible cards in the Journey and Scrapbook might have abilities that adjust that score. Once all effects have been applied, the player with the highest star count is the winner.
Backseat Driver Variant
If you want to really press your luck and give up a little control, try out the Backseat Driver Variant. In this variant players may choose to play the face-up card on their opponent’s journey as well as their own. At the end of each turn you will check to see if either player busts.
Solo Mode - Designed by Kevin Ellenburg and Mike Mullins
The game will come with rules for solo play. Here you will face an AI explorer that thinks through its action each turn similarly to a player (playing the more intense Backseat Driver Variant). This explorer never rests in its pursuit of adventure.
If you would like to try the game yourself, the mostly black and white preview PNP is available at PNP Arcade now!
https://www.pnparcade.com/products/death-valley-kickstarter-preview

This expansion consists of 6 more cards, letting you customize the deck before playing Death Valley. Before play, organize all the base game and expansion cards by hazard type. Then select 3 Animal, 4 Flood, 5 Terrain, and 6 Heat cards to shuffle into the deck. Unselected cards will not be used. Includes Vultures, Panamint City, Red Cathedral, Ubehebe Crater, Zabriskie Point, and Panamint Dunes.

As always, if you reach $25.00, you will  also receive free shipping. (NOTE: We previously offered a US Backer  code to combine games to save on shipping, but in most cases this was a  much better deal of free shipping AND 15% off.)
International Backers only - go to our website http://www.buttonshygames.com and place an order using the coupon code "0321international" (REPEAT: THIS IS FOR BACKERS ONLY) to get free shipping on your extra game(s). Note: The limit on this  offer is 3 wallet games (and up to 3 expansions) total, including  anything that you order at Kickstarter. Anything above 3 wallet games  (and 3  expansions)  will end up bumping into the next shipping tier,  which can be as much as  $10 on international orders. These games will  all ship together with your Kickstarter rewards.
There are many notable games and we'll be featuring those throughout the campaign.
While the game includes lots of great little historical facts about Death Valley, here's a little history about the game itself.
Death Valley was originally Kevin Ellenburg's entry to the 18 Card Challenge: Design A Game About A Real Life Location, and we’re happy to see it coming to life. It has a unique take on the familiar push-your-luck mechanic where players have to think about managing their hazards as well as the card abilities, making each choice matter beyond the immediate threat of busting. On top of that, the gorgeous art from Fachri Maulana perfectly captures the lonely beauty of Death Valley National Park.
First up is Kevin's initial pitch video in it's entirety (note some changes were made to the gameplay and cards throughout development):
And here is the 18 Card Challenge video where it was a finalist, along with two other games that we eventually published, Skulls of Sedlec and Horreos. All 3 of which are available here. 


We have an awesome following of repeat customers. As a result, we've built the Board Game of the Month Club.

Our 2021 $5+ packages include an episode of The Final Lightyear.
Gather your crew and gear and launch into a  fringe section of space where the law teeters over the edge and a good  captain can earn a living. There's no shortage of threats that endanger  the goodfolk of deep space, but luckily your torpedo bay is full and  lasers are hot.
In Lightyear you'll play solo or cooperative with a friend, as the  captain of a so-called starship, in hopes of earning some rewards and a  decent rep. Using tactical maneuvering and dice-based action selection,  you'll work through the sector's small, medium and large enemies trying  to gain rewards and ultimately live to see another day. Customizable  episodes will challenge you with variable enemies and threats while  offering powerful new gear and talented crew to help you in your  adventures.
Our $10 packages include all of the above and something   extra. Generally it's a tiny game (up to 9 cards), or some expansion  / promo cards for our existing games.
And our $20 package includes all of the above and a copy of   the featured wallet game (or the wallet game of your choice).   The featured wallet games also come with any expansion material that  is given away in the Kickstarter campaigns (like the Panamint City expansion  here).

With our method of publishing and using multiple manufacturers, there's always a chance that one part of the game could come in with an error, leading to delays. We've been able to minimize these errors in recent years, but they can happen from time to time. We've also upped our pre-press staff internally to make sure we can hit intended deadlines.

With COVID-19 some of our suppliers have been delayed, so we've been allowing additional time in our estimations and setting up backup suppliers as well. Our local staff is working while socially distancing, so we are allowing additional time for a smaller staff to assemble and ship games. 

Our unfulfilled projects are moving along according to schedule. Ugly Gryphon Inn is shipping now, two months ahead of schedule. Our Agropolis Campaign is scheduled to be fulfilled in March and backers are up to date with the progress. Our Reprint Campaign is due to fulfill in June and moving ahead as planned.

You own the questionably prestigious Ugly Gryphon Inn, which is the only Inn within a hundred miles. Your patrons are rowdy  and rude, but they are the only ones around. Your goal is to fill your inn with enough patrons to keep the debt collectors at bay, but to do so  you must manage some painfully particular, peculiar patrons.
In The Ugly Gryphon Inn, you’ll be tasked with managing your patrons’ various needs to ensure they all get a good night’s rest. Each turn, you’ll send one drowsy patron up to their room, then check to make sure all your patrons are sleeping soundly. If something’s irking them, they might raise a fuss, so keep an eye on what they need as you go. Afterwards, you’ll usher in more guests and keep an eye on the bar to make sure there’s no trouble. There’s never a moment to rest in The Ugly Gryphon Inn!
A quick note on our Simply Solo line
We kicked off our Simply Solo line in May of 2020 with Food Chain Island. Ugly Gryphon Inn is the second in the series. Each game is designed by Scott Almes and focuses on games that are one player only, light on rules and big on replayability. 
And now, a look at Ugly Gryphon Inn
The Ugly Gryphon Inn offers the kinds of brain-stretching puzzle that Scott Almes brought to our first Simply Solo title, Food Chain Island. While they’re both easy to dive into and endlessly replayable, here the focus is on managing each patron’s needs while preparing for the next round of requests. 
Carefully booking your guests in the right order is key to success, as each patron’s frustrations can have consequences for the sleepers below them. All the while, though, you’ll have to expect the unexpected to make sure each new guest is comfortable. With a horde of disgruntled customers on their way, you’ll have to be clever to run The Ugly Gryphon Inn.

Simply shuffle the deck of patron cards and place them in a face-down stack in front of you. Draw 4 cards and arrange them in a face-up row in front of you. These patrons are considered to be at the bar.
The game takes place in a series of turns until you’ve played all the cards from the deck and your hand. Each turn has the following flow:
Phase I: Patron goes to sleep
One of the patrons at the bar are ready for bed. Select a card from the bar area and place it at the top of the inn. The inn is a single vertical line of cards, with each card being a floor.
I choose to move the Sleepy Summoner into the Inn.
Check Rooms for Phase I irks. 
Starting with the Patron you just placed, you check each patron card from top to bottom. You check the statement on their card to see what will irk them and cause them to leave. If the conditions are met, then apply the effects on their card. 

Phase II: New Patron(s) Arrives
Adds one more patron to the bar until you have 4. If there are no cards left in the draw deck, then this is the final round.
I draw the Charitable Giant and add it to the Bar.
Check for Quirks
Evaluate the quirk icons in the bar. If there are 3 or more of the same type of quirk, then you irk all the Inn patrons that are sensitive to that bad effect! 
In the Bar there are 3 Fighting icons, which means anyone in the Inn that is irked by Fighting will trigger their effect.
Since the Sleepy Summoner is not irked by fighting, her effect does not trigger. She'll stay in the Inn!
Game End
After you’ve run out of cards in the deck, then count how many patrons you have in the inn. If you have 7 or more patrons in the inn - you’ve won! If you have less than 7 or if at any point 8 patrons are in the discard pile, then you have lost the game.

campaign.story:
Xtron Pro is a programmable handheld game console that is ideal for running MakeCode Arcade & NES games and creating DIY projects from electronics to mobile robots, Xtron Pro also transforms into a wearable device with customized interfaces and functions by visual programming.
Xtron Pro is a fun and educational programmable game console for kids and juniors to learn to code. It provides an easy entry point for those who are just beginning to code and sparks their interest in STEAM!
Xtron Pro is versatile with it's modular design. The core of Xtron Pro has a 4 pins connector which can be used to connect extension sensors and electronic modules with I2C buses, and a multifunctional magnetic pogo pin connector to connect game controller, robots, and lots more.
Learn How to Program by Playing Games with Ovobot’s Xtron Pro
 The Xtron Pro is a handheld console that utilizes MakeCode Arcade, allowing users to design games and other DIY projects.

Not Just a Game Console
Xtron Pro is born out of the Xtron project. During the initial development phases, we received a lot of feedback from Xtron backers. Xtron is a bare circuit board, great for building up electronic hardware knowledge, however, it was not portable and the bare board can be easily damaged.  Since then, a Xtron upgrade came into being. We hoped it would be more compact, exquisite, and portable, and it could truly empower children's growth and learning, not just a programmable game console.
Eventually, this leads us to a clear goal, to make a multifunctional programmable mobile console for children - the Xtron Pro. With Xtron Pro, the user can define its functions through programming, run self-programmed games, customize smartwatches, and even build IoT and robot projects. We believe this approach will help to unleash the potential for children to let their imagination run wild. The Xtron Pro programmable game console is divided into two parts: the core and the game pad. We have also determined one core and multiple extensions R & D direction.
Run MakeCode Arcade Games
MakeCode Arcade is a code editor to build Retro Arcade games for the browser and handheld consoles.
arcade.makecode.com
You can build games by visual program language, Javascript or Python in MakeCode Arcade. During development, run and test your games within the simulator, then download them to Xtron Pro to play anywhere at anytime.
Xtron Pro is built in lots of hardware modules to enhance function to game programming.
 Design Games Directly on Xtron Pro 
With the TileCode newly designed by Microsoft, you can even design, code, and play games directly on Xtron Pro.
Magnetic Modular Design
The magnetic modular design makes programming more creative and playable. Rotating the core can switch between portrait and landscape mode, so you can build games in either orientation.
The pogo pin magnetic adsorption connection is convenient for assembly and disassembly, and it is more convenient and safer than any other plug-in connections.
Store Multiple Games
Xtron Pro has a built-in 16 megabytes flash memory. On the basis of the origin bootloader, we added a file system to it, which makes it convienent to store, browse and load multiple game firmware.
Browse and load the new firmware
To upgrade your Xtron Pro, it's as simple as connecting your Xtron Pro to your computer with the USB-C cable to copy the new firmwares to the disk.
At present, most MakeCode Arcade compatible handheld consoles on the market can only store one firmware at a time and require a computer to upgrade the firmware. You will have a better experience with the built-in 16M flash memory and file system.
Built-in High Accuracy IMU Sensor
The built-in IMU sensor with high accuracy leads to the fun of the game to go beyond the buttons. You can create motion sensing games with it, bringing a whole new level of interaction to the games you create.
In addition to be used for game control, IMU sensors can also be used to measure vibration, calculate angles, and count steps.
Multiple Players
Having multiple Xtron Pros connected through data wires makes it possible to experience the joy of multiplayer games and online collaboration.
On top of your own games, Xtron pro also supports to run thousands of classic NES games. Such as Super Mario, Contra, Pac-Man, etc.
It's easy to transfer the Xtron Pro to a NES simulator, simply download NES games from internet and copy XTRON_NES.uf2 (developed by our team in Microsoft uf2 format which is the same as MakeCode Arcade Games) to Xtron Pro drive disk.
Xmaker Programming Platform
We have also developed a dedicated software platform for Xtron Pro, Xmaker. It has rich program blocks and image resources to make it easier for beginners with limited knowledge of programming. 
Xmaker code editor for Xtron Pro, URL: xmaker.ovobot.cc(Beta)
based on MakeCode, we have added Xtron Pro-specific functions on the basis of Arcade, such as watch-related program blocks, IoT and speech recognition, etc.
Turn Xtron Pro into a Smartwatch
We designed a trendy wristband for Xtron Pro, an arc-shaped silicone case, and adjustable watchband. With it, Xtron Pro instantly transforms a smartwatch.
Xtron Pro has a built-in high-precision clock chip and backup battery. Through programming, the clock interface of the watch can be customized to whatever design that you like.
Create a Pedometer
With built-in acceleration sensor, Xtron Pro can be used to create a step counter, you can customize your own motion detection device through programming.
DIY a Countdown Timer
Combining the accelerometer sensor and clock function, you can make a countdown timer to simulate an hourglass.
With the advent of 5G, the era of the IoT is getting closer, from smart homes to smart cities, from industrial IoT to smart agriculture, and the IoT has penetrated into every corner of our lives. The IoT as a system is a multi-disciplinary integration involving networking technology, sensor technology, automatic control technology and big data processing. It coincides with the STEM promoted in education. STEM education encourages the cultivation of multi-disciplinary comprehensive quality. Programming is a main axis of these comprehensive qualities, and a complex system can be realized through programming. XtronPro is a multifunctional mobile programming console specially designed for children. In addition to make games and wearable devices, it can also be used to develop IoT applications.
Built-in Wi-Fi Module
After connecting to the Wi-Fi network through your custom program, you can explore the rich networking functions of Xtron Pro.
IoT MQTT Server
Through the MQTT server, Xtron Pro can establish connection with the mobile APP, so you can monitor the sensor data, or control the hardwares remotely.
IoT APP
The Xtron Pro IoT APP supports data visualization of existing sensors and remote control of output modules.
The data endpoint in the APP is convenient to link up with visual program blocks, and the Xmaker provides a wealth of program blocks related to IoT applications.
Sensor Kit
Xtron Pro has a 4PIN connector, which can be connected to extension modules. We now have three sensor modules and three output modules, these include: ultrasonic, potentiometer and soil moisture sensor, servo controller, touch & led and 7-Segment display modules.
The existing sensors and modules are not very rich, we need your help to develop more modules to enrich the functions of Xtron Pro.
Speech Recognition
When the Xtron Pro is connected to the Internet, it can recognize speech. The speech command can be customized through programming with provided APIs.
You can make IoT projects with Xtron Pro's sensors & modules and use Wi-Fi to connect to a cloud for speech control applications.
Text to Speech
In addition to recognizing speech, Xtron Pro can also convert text to speech. Why not DIY a dialogue robot?
Xtron Pro is a systematic project, it includes hardware, software, platform, server, App, as and courses. We have done our best to advance the development of the project with limited resources. Reaching the origin goal will help us continue completing the development. So far we have achieved phased success, the hardware is ready for mass production, and we have paid part of mold costs. After the funding is raised, we will use it to pay for the remaining mold costs, as well making mass production possible.
Xtron Pro has strong scalability. We have conceived a wealth of extension modules, such as lego extensions and robots. Our philosophy is one core multiple extensions. We have set a stretch goal at $100,000, if we reach this goal, we will gift one extension module in the Xtron Pro kit to encourage you to explore Xtron Pro's extensive features, and more colors will be unlocked.
Color options
Bluetooth function
With Bluetooth, you can interact with Xtron Pro using your smartphone, or you can use your smartphone to program Xtron Pro in real time. CA$200k, we will start the work, including firmwares and mobile app.
3D Models
Sketches
Prototypes

updates.update_content:
At this point in time, if I say that I am very excited to announce that we have all shipped out, someone will definitely dismiss it. But we did work hard to overcome all kinds of difficulties, and finally all the packages have been sent out, except for some orders that did not fill in the survey, and some orders with logistics problems.
I’m really sorry for the delay, we seriously underestimated the difficulty of production. We could have delivered the packages before the Chinese New Year, but we found some problems in the production process, some problems cannot be solved because the suppliers were on holiday. We can only pick out some good products and send out. After the holiday, we immediately started to solve the production problems, but it really takes time for each problem. This process lasted about a month before we started the second batch of production.

Dear backers,
Time flies, March is about to end. 
After the Chinese New Year, we did not stop for a moment. We summarized the problems encountered in production last year, and solved the problems one by one. The production situation of the foundry that was temporarily changed last year was not very good, we finally decided not to find a foundry for production. There are two reasons. The first is that our volume is too small for the foundry, and we can't find a large-scale foundry, if we keep looking like this, it may take a long time. The second is that our production process has not been run in well, our plan is to assemble ourselves first, and run in the production process during the assembly process to prepare for mass production in the future.

Dear backers,
To be honest, we cannot ship all packages before the Spring Festival. We encountered some problems in production, according to the plan, we produced Xtron Pro on the 25th of last month, but our foundry was closed early due to the Covid. In order to be able to deliver on time, we temporarily changed the foundry, but mass production is far more complicated than we thought, we want to make a product that is perfect in every aspect, so we decided to produce in batches to avoid product defects.

Dear backers,
It's a busy month. In the past few days, we have received some backers inquirie about the progress of the project, and our promised delivery deadline is approaching. 
After more than two months of preparations, our products are finally ready for production. In these two months, we experienced chip shortages, insufficient supplier capacity, and the factory’s early holiday. But through the unremitting efforts of our team, we have overcome the difficulties one by one, including developping more chip suppliers and stationing at the factory. As of today, we have only one material that has not all arrived yet, but we can now put existing materials on line for production, and we will start shipping tomorrow.

campaign.story:
You survey the terrain ahead. Do you grab your driver (the 20-sided die), or the 4-iron (10-sided)?
Welcome to Roll In One, a quick and casual dice golfing game! Use a variety of custom-sided dice and unique gameplay to drive, chip, putt, slice, and hook your way around player-designed golf courses.
Take turns choosing a die and rolling to see how far your ball flies. The kicker is that successful rolls keep you in the air; you must keep rolling and moving until you fail! Choose wisely, as the wrong club will put you far in the rough.
Use the terrain to your advantage, if you can, and the Golfer and Caddie Card bonuses, to be the first to complete each hole. Do you have what it takes to get a Roll in One?
Plastic insert
The components will be delivered in a compact box (18.5 x 18.5 x 4 centimeters), with a custom insert.
(3d printed mockup of the plastic insert, it will have softer corners)
Don Eskridge, creator of The Resistance and Avalon:
"My favorite moment of Roll in One happens every turn: I use logic & guts to choose which custom die will best get Ball to Hole quick and without (too much) chance of crashing. I love that choice! Then I start rolling and the fates crash down, to my joy or dismay. I'm fine with both because I chose how to swing. The game's got logic and luck, and it's a romp to play. I don't golf but I dig this."
--
Gameplay
1. Gather your group, and deal each player a Golfer, a ball token, and some Caddie Cards.
2. One player designs a hole by selecting and arranging a handful of board pieces.
3. Taking turns, starting from the tee, choose a die and roll to see how far you go. You move forward whenever you beat your last number. You must move forward a space or follow any special symbols on the die!
4. First to the hole wins, and all others score based on distance from the hole. Use Caddie Cards and Golfer abilities to get an edge on the way.
 Solo play
Just like real golf, you can go out on the links on your own. Design your own holes and see how close to or below par you can reach, and even post your favorite course designs online! #rollinone

Why pledge?
 Get 10% off the MSRP | And shipped to you first, as backers.
 Exclusives | Get Golfer and Caddie cards available only through this campaign.
 Improvements | The more the Kickstarter raises, the more we can improve the quality and quantity of components in the game.
 This will only come to life with your assistance | Producing a board game is an expensive process, from the design to the manufacturing to the shipping, every step requires time, testing, and money. This game won't happen without your support. (And please try out the game for free, to confirm that you want it to happen!) 
Want to buy multiple copies?
 Just select your pledge level, then put in a dollar amount equal to the Pledge Level multiplied by the Number of copies you want to buy. Shipping is a flat rate and DOES NOT INCREASE with additional copies! (Excludes the Founder's pledge level.)
The following chart lists the estimated costs from our fulfillment company to ship a single copy to each country/region in 2021. We are subsidizing the cost for backers, to give you a discount for helping us make this possible. 
To simplify the process for everyone, if you purchase more than one copy, shipping remains the same flat fee to any address, regardless of how many copies are ordered. (So you save more, the more you buy!)

Retailers

If you received a personal message from me a few weeks ago, then send me your address! 18 remain.
Manufacturing is complete!

We're on the back nine, after nabbing a snack and drink from the clubhouse.
NOTE: If you have not supplied your address yet, please do so. I am sending the address list to the shipper this month! 23 extant addresses remain. We're determining where to ship each of the four pallets based on your addresses. As it stands, we'll send one pallet to an EU warehouse, and the other three to the US. 
Manufacturing is rolling
I received a message last Friday that the paper components (cards, rulebook, box, board pieces) are finished printing this week. All of these get printed in big flat sheets, and they're sending me one prepared copy to get approval before they cut, shape, package the remaining thousands. (If anything is wrong, it's a lot of money now to fix and reprint, but they still check before each step.) Dice are being manufactured by a partner company that only makes dice, and they are scheduled to be delivered end of this month. Once LongPack receives the dice, they'll package everything up and then in early May it'll be time for a couple massive ships to carry the pallets over the ocean. The pallets will take a couple months to reach their warehouses.

campaign.story:
Welcome to The Mariana Trench, a solo or 2 player pocket sized game that plays in 10-15 minutes. Your objective as a deep-sea researcher is to guide your sub through fathoms of water, descending to the Trench floor, to find mysterious and amazing sea creatures.
Will you become a renowned research scientist, or will you fall victim to the creatures that lurk beneath the surface?
INTRODUCTION
The goal of The Mariana Trench is to score the most research points by researching deep-sea creatures and the floor of the trench. The game is played in alternating turns until your submarines run out of oxygen. 
MOVEMENT
Movement from one card to the next represents a distance of 1000 Fathoms. At launch your sub can move up to 2000 fathoms (2 cards) on your turn. 
COLLECTING RESEARCH AND UPGRADES
When researching the water column, reveal the (research) card next to your sub. Each card displays a deep-sea creature and a submarine upgrade. 
You may:
• Collect the deep-sea creature, or
• Upgrade your Submarine
If you do not collect the creature or upgrade your sub then leave the card face-up, where either player may collect it on a future turn.
If you have hold capacity you may tuck the research card under your sub (to the right), so that the class and size of the creature shows.
If you do not collect the sea creature then you can upgrade your sub. Tuck the card under your sub (to the left) so that the upgrade is showing. You cannot take the same upgrade twice.
Your sub starts with a small hold, which can carry one small creature. To collect large creatures you must upgrade your hold first.  

THE TRENCH FLOOR
Each time your sub reaches the trench floor you can conduct valuable scientific research. Take 1 research token from the supply and place it on your submarine. Your sub can only carry one research token at a time. The token is offloaded as soon as you surface beside the research vessel.  Research tokens are worth 2RP at the end of the game.
RETURNING TO THE RESEARCH SHIP
When your sub surfaces, all the creatures and tokens are offloaded to the research vessel. At the end of the game points are scored for different sets of creatures

campaign.story:
Take on the role of a tough beetle with a bad attitude and something to prove.
Push your opponents out of the ring and become the greatest insect wrestling champion.
The time and place is spring in Japan after the Rhinoceros Beetles (AKA Kabutomushi, Japanese for ‘helmet bug’), have returned home from their travels. Now, out in the wild, you can find them butting heads to show off their wrestling skills and impress their insect friends  (We’re not joking, it’s a real thing).
This is the origin of the phenomenal World Insect Wrestling Championship. In Kabuto Sumo, you are one of the contending beetles, battling for supremacy in the ring and your place in the pantheon of legendary wrestlers.
Kabuto Sumo utilizes a slide/push mechanic not commonly seen in many board games.
Kabuto Sumo takes inspiration from those physical interaction games you know and love, but ups the ante with up to 16 playable wrestlers that add variable rules and uniquely shaped "signature move" pieces that are guaranteed to disrupt your expectations.
It’s an exciting combination of physicality, strategy, and luck. 
You’re going to enjoy the components as much as the great gameplay.
Real wood game pieces for every base game and expansion pack provide a satisfying bounce after falling off and hitting the table.
Large tarot cards (nearly 2x standard size) for the wrestlers show off the incredible artwork.
Everything has been thoughtfully designed and crafted.
The box is a small size that will easily fit on your shelves or in your game bag.
6.75 inches wide x 10.75 inches tall x 2.25 inches deep.
All of the expansion components will fit inside the base box too!

Playtested through hundreds of matches, every bit of Kabuto Sumo is guaranteed to provide exciting gameplay.
Kabuto Sumo isn't "just a kids game".
Yes, it is a game kids can play, but it is also 100% a game adults can play with each other. You can play with your kids, with your significant other, with friends, and your friend's kids. Each experience will be different and fun in its own way.
A ton of effort has been put into the design to create special moves and unique physical interactions that can dramatically affect how you play the game.
During setup, each player will pick their favorite color wrestler to represent them in the ring.
Your opponent's wrestler piece is the ultimate one you want to knock out.
When it's set up, get ready to rumble!
Consider each wrestler's special abilities and signature moves!
Depending on you've chosen to play as, you may perform their signature move before or after you slide a piece on the board. Each move may only be performed once per turn, at most.
Players will have an idea of how the pieces will shift around when they push a traditional round disc against another disc piece, but be ready for anything to happen!
The signature move pieces with their special varying shapes, sizes, and weights will cause unique interactions that challenge your understanding of physics and create unusual outcomes.
By offering two ways to win Kabuto Sumo, players can adapt to changing conditions and play to their wrestler's strengths.
Kabuto Sumo brings together some of the toughest insects from around the world to compete in the ring.
Each insect has a signature move with special advantages that connect to their real-life physiological features.
Right now there are 6 base game beetle wrestlers and 6 expansion wrestlers that add non-beetle insects.
It’s up to YOU to help reach the stretch goals that add 4 new characters to the game - 2 beetles for the base game and 2 insects for the expansion.
Update: AllStretch Goal wrestlers unlocked! That's 8 wrestlers each for both the base game and expansion for a total of 16!
The base game includes a wide variety of beetles (that actually exist!) from across the world.
“Mushi” is Japanese for insect and “kabuto” is Japanese for helmet. This refers to the fact that this beetle’s horns look like a samurai helmet. When he fights for dominance he will use his forked horn to lift the other beetle up and throw them into the air.
Stag Beetles are characterized by their huge antler-like mandibles. The head and jaws of this beetle alone can be as large as the rest of its body combined.
To ward off predators, Blister Beetles secrete cantharidin, a poisonous chemical that causes blistering to the skin. This chemical has many medicinal uses from removing warts to being the main ingredient in the folk remedy “Spanish Fly”.
Male Hercules Beetles have a large thoracic horn that can extend up to 4 inches. They are named for their incredible strength and can carry at least 100 times their body mass in weight.
Bombardier Beetles shoot a hot noxious spray from their abdomen as a defense mechanism. An exothermic reaction created from the mixing of chemicals within the beetle heats the spray to nearly boiling.
 Desert Ironclad Beetles utilize a tried and true defense mechanism where they will feign being dead until they can safely escape from the predator.
The Titan Beetle is the largest known beetle, with a body that can reach up to 6.6 inches in length. Its strong jaws can snap a pencil in half or tear into human flesh. 
Dung Beetles consume animal dung as a food source. To transport the dung back to their burrow, they usually roll the dung into a ball then push along the ground with its hind legs.


To keep the gameplay and character development fresh, the expansion pack introduces a wide variety of non-beetle insects.
Denkimushi, meaning “electric bug” in Japanese, is the larval form of a moth common to Eastern Asia. The tiny hairs on the caterpillar cause a poisonous sting that feels similar to getting an electric shock.
An ambush predator that uses its long forelegs to grab hold of prey. They not only eat other insects but also small vertebrates like lizards, fish, and small birds. 
 This centipede has 22 pairs of legs and on its head two sharp venomous claws known as forcipules. It will attempt to eat any animal smaller than itself.
These giant crickets are found only in New Zealand and can be some of the heaviest insects in the world, weighing up to 70 grams. They have enlarged spiny hind legs that they use for fighting.
 As the longest insect in the world, the stick insect's primary defense mechanism is its excellent camouflage, where it mimics leaves or branches to be almost unidentifiable.
The real Giant Forest Scorpion is the world’s largest scorpion species, growing up to 9 inches in length. As its venom is not immediately deadly, this insect prefers to kill prey with its powerful claws.
As the world’s largest hornet, it uses its enormous 1/4 inch stinger to inject potent venom. Multiple stings can even be deadly to humans, and has a history of terrorizing bee hives, which is how it earned the nickname “Murder Hornet”.

The female Jewel Wasp literally takes control of cockroaches. She stings the roach to make it docile, then she leads the roach back to her burrow. Once inside she lays her eggs on the roach, which will become food for the newly hatched larva.
Please note:
The game in the video is an unfinished prototype. The final product will have some improvements and changes.
This is a “Preview”, not a “Review”. That means this video is only meant to show what the gameplay is like. Any commentary is their own.

PLAY

Chad saw Tony's early prototype for Kabuto Sumo on Twitter and immediately connected with both the theme and gameplay. It perfectly fit in with our love of quick but highly engaging tabletop games.
The self-proclaimed Purple People Meeter of the Warm Fuzzies Tribe (His words! We couldn't write anything that catchy.), Tony Miller is the designer of Kabuto Sumo. His son's love of coin-dozer arcade machines was the first inspiration for this game.
He's one half of the board game design team of Fire in the Library, and one third of the Breaking into Board Games podcast. He lives in the Portland, Oregon area with his family who inspires him to design games in between his Operations Engineer day job and the occasional nap.
We admit, although beetles and other insects can be pretty rad, they typically aren't the most glamorous. It was necessary for Kabuto Sumo to have an artist who could bring the unique personality of each insect wrestler to life.

 Kwanchai Moriya is an illustrator and painter with a degree in Illustration from the Art Center College of Design.
A friend of Tony's, Kwanchai had a chance to play an early prototype of Kabuto Sumo at a convention. He felt a personal connection to its theme and was immediately delighted by the game. Once as a child, having spent a summer visiting his grandparents in rural Japan, he was given a wrestling beetle in a little plastic cage as a parting gift. Nothing could've been more exotic and fun, for a midwestern kid from the suburbs.
To make sure the game design maximized every bit of excitement and tension, we brought on John Brieger and Michael Dunsmore to playtest hundreds of matches, solidify the mechanics, and help us create the "signature move" pieces that cause truly unique and interesting interactions. 
Based in Sunnyvale, California, Brieger Development is an independent studio of boardgame developers specializing in helping publishers, licenseholders, and designers turn prototypes into marketable products.  Founded by former Apple Inc. designer John Brieger, they leverage deep knowledge on product development processes & design research to get games rigorously tested with a broad set of players.

 The base price is ONLY $29 right now!
After the campaign, it will go up to $34 and the expansion will remain at $15. The game will not be in traditional distribution, but we will sell wholesale cases to brick-and-mortar stores who contact us directly.
 QE - Save the economy and buy out companies in this interactive auction game.
 On Tour - USA and Europe - Be the best tour manager and get your band to as many states or countries as possible in this roll-n-write game.
 Loot of Lima - Get the buried treasure before the other pirates in this deduction game.
 Bites - Snack your way to the top of the anthill in a commodity speculation game based on the Spiel des Jahres Recommended "Big Points".
 Three Small Games Set (GPS, Mountain Goats, Sequoia) - Designed to be crazy easy to teach and fast playing, these 10 minute games cram in a bunch of tension and thrills.
PS: You can keep all these games closed tight with our four-way "Game-Shut" rubber bands that secure all four sides! The medium fits the standard box and the small is great for the small games.
Our Premium Board Game Bag is a fan favorite. Designed specifically for board games, it can fit 7 "Ticket to Ride" sized boxes, is padded and water-resistant for protection, available in three colors, and offers 4 different carrying methods (horizontal + vertical handles, shoulder strap, and backpack straps).
It will carry your games to the finish line every time!
Increase your wrestler options 30% by unlocking 4 exciting wrestlers!
These are not just cosmetic upgrades either. Each stretch goal wrestler will further increase the enjoyment of Kabuto Sumo with a special signature move and corresponding signature move piece that add extra strategic elements to each game.

campaign.story:
Leaves whispering, chickens clucking, tractors rumbling, the sounds of a bustling farm are everywhere. The countryside is blossoming and you are in charge of it all. The last team of planners couldn’t cut it, so the farmers turned to your team, the best of the best. If anyone can turn this little farm into a flourishing ranching community, it’s you!
Agropolis is a standalone Sprawlopolis game. What does that mean? Well it's more of what we built with Sprawlopolis, but instead of more cities, it's farms. It adds a few new twists (livestock and feed fees), and can be played on its own or combined with Sprawlopolis in a fun new way. 
Agropolis will be the 66th game to join our growing line of Wallet Games
A quick note on Sprawlopolis
We've made over 60 Wallet Games by now and it's safe to say that there's something really special about Sprawlopolis. It has been nominated for the Golden Geek Awards for Best Card Game and Best Solo Game, was voted #31 in the 1-Player Guild's People Choice Top 200 Solo Games, and has received the Dice Tower's Seal of Excellence.
It's been a wild ride.
It's gone on to have multiple sold out printings, and is currently available in many languages from our publishing partners from all over the world. Once again, a very special game and we are really excited to expand on it. 
And now, a look at Agropolis
In Agropolis, 1-4 players work together to build a new farm from the ground up. Using only 18 cards and a variable scoring system, the game is never the same twice. 
First, players will randomly flip over 3 cards to see the scoring rules for the game.

In this game, you will try to keep Pig Pens adjacent to your longest road, align your Orchards into specific polyomino shapes, and keep your Cornfields on the corners of the map.
But  not only do these 3 cards determine how you will score this game, they  also determine how you win. Total up the values of all three cards, and that number is the score that you need to reach in order to win.

The example above is just one of many, many combinations (816 to be  exact!). Each game has drastically different scoring rules in unique  combinations, and a new score to beat, ranging from 6 to 51 points.

A look at half of the scoring conditions in Agropolis
Each turn, players will play one card from their hand to the growing countryside, trying to score as many points as possible.
Players will have to communicate and plan without revealing their own cards in order to most efficiently develop large areas in each of the 4 zone types.
Watch out though, road maintenance isn't cheap and each road will cost you points in the end.
New to Agropolis are the three types of livestock pens, each in two different configurations.
And finally there's the Feed Fee: a fun (and optional) new way to raise the goal just a little bit, making for a tougher game.
When all cards have been placed, the game ends and players see if they have met the dynamically generated minimum score for their game.
Can you meet the demands of the farmers, work with your fellow planners and build the ultimate agricultural wonder? It’s time to find out!

Download the preview PNP today at PNPArcade.com!
https://www.pnparcade.com/collections/new-games/products/agropolis
We'll start with a little coverage of the original game, Sprawlopolis. It's been out for 2 years now and has slowly built up a stable of great reviews and video content. Here are a few of note:
And now for Agropolis. 
https://whatsericplaying.com/2020/09/28/agropolis/
https://www.dastardlydesignco.com/post/agropolis-dastardly-review-135
http://www.purplephoenixgames.com/agropolis-preview/

In previous campaigns we created expansion material and used it as stretch goals. Since 2018, we've just given it away from the start.  So no worries on whether we'll hit it or not, you are getting bonus content if you pledge here. The free expansion for this campaign is Combopolis. 

Use this expansion to create the perfect mix of city and farm zones in a single game. It adds 6 cards with scoring conditions relying on both Sprawlopolis and Agropolis, along with a few really interesting new rules (you'll draw one card from each game, choose one to play, and then discard the other). It unlocks an exciting world of new combinations!

updates.update_content:
Hello everyone! 
We are down to the very very end here. As of right now, I can count 37 packages that Marty is working on shipping. These were ones that had address issues or other issues that needed to be resolved. After that we have another 15 that are in the process of resolving the issues. Aside from that, I need to do a final check on addresses that errored - sometimes they are too long, or have characters that the mail program doesn't recognize. I believe there may be 10 or so of those at a quick count. Which puts us at about 52 packages out of almost 6500. Less than 1% left. :)

updates.update_userinfo: Missed last week's update, but we're 88% shipped!
updates.update_content: Sorry for missing last week's update. It was quite a week here. We were getting the shipping team into place in the main office and realizing the difficulty of the assembly team being in the other office. This just meant I was driving games between offices all day, carrying them up and down stairs and questioning whether it would be faster just to assemble them myself (the answer is that it's not, but all of that back and forth can get to your head). Then after that physical and logistical nightmare, I had a technological nightmare to deal with.

Last week was week 3 of shipping. By now we expected to be at 37.5% shipped, but we hit 55% shipped, breaking that crucial halfway point. We currently have 3595 out the door as we're heading into week 4. This week we are shifting gears and working on some of the more complex and slower packages as we wait for a new batch of Sprawlopolis Interstate rules to arrive. Once those arrive on Friday, I'll cut them all, assign the team to start sleeving them and week 5 will be a huge wave of All-opolis again. 
There isn't much else to report at this time, but as we hit the middle, I am beat! So many trips from office to office, and back and forth to the post office. But we have some great news about both of those. First we were able to move our shipping team into the main office as they are both vaccinated (the assembly team is still in another building in the next town over). Second, because there is now someone working out of our main office all the time, we were able to FINALLY arrange for daily post office pick-ups. No more fighting for a parking space then paying to park, then hauling 9 bins just to stand in line at the post office.

updates.update_userinfo: Week two of shipping is done and we are at....
updates.update_content:
Hello everyone! 
Here's our week two shipping update. :) 
Last week we hit 2976 shipped, getting us to 45% of the campaign out the door!

updates.update_userinfo: 25% of the packages are out the door!
updates.update_content:
Hey everyone! We're been shipping for a week and hit 25% shipped. That's 1636 packages out the door. We are still expecting a 6-8 week fulfillment, as those were some of the easiest and fastest ones to move, but it feels great to hit that mark. We're really seeing what our assembly and shipping limits are here, and our crew of 5 people per day (plus me and my kids) are really working nicely. Next week we add a 6th person, just to make sure other things aren't falling behind while most of the group is focused on Agropolis.
I'll post one of these each Monday, letting you know where we are at.

updates.update_userinfo: March update: The cards are shipping out to us tomorrow!
updates.update_content:
This is the email I've been waiting for. It isn't much, but it's everything I wanted: 
This means the cards will arrive here next week. From there, our work is cut out for us. It's going to be about 300 hours of separating and assembly (I really should show off our silly process), so we are now bringing in a few more workers to try to get that down to about 4-6 weeks of assembling. Mail will happen along side of that, probably mailing 1200 a week for the same 4-6 weeks. Keep in mind, all of this won't start until they get here, which should be next week if all goes well.

campaign.story:
Mighty Maniax Artwork by Ben Templesmith
Decades ago, cartoons were made from toys, and video games were made from cartoons. Its always been a dream of mine to bring a world like Masters of the Universe, Transformers, or TMNT to life. Mighty Maniax is being created in that same spirit.
Mighty Maniax Artwork by Ian Ameling
This is a new 3" line of action figures inspired by vintage collectibles like, Battle Beasts, Army Ants, and Hasbro era WWF figures. Heavily influenced by video games and cartoons of the '80s and '90s, these characters represent a wild world of action, horror, and sci-fi fantasy. Johnny Tombstone is the main character and hero of the Mighty Maniax world. His supernatural abilities to sense evil and destroy it are unparalleled. Equipped with an Evo-cannon and containment pack, he sets out to balance the forces of good and evil with the most unlikely of companions.
Mighty Maniax Artwork by Megan Hutchison-Cates
Among his band of misfit monsters are Fishstik, a hyper-intelligent water creature, and Viper, a fast-talking Ninja by day; deadly Werewolf by night. Enter a world of frightening monsters and mighty heroes with the all new Mighty Maniax action figures.
Mighty Maniax Wave One
Toy molds are expensive! From a 12" figure to these smaller 3" figures, it takes a large amount of funding to get them made. We are looking to KickStarter backers to raise the funds to cover the molds and production for this creator-owned line of toys.
1988 Lamborghini Countach Not Included.
Each Mighty Maniax figure comes with 1 body, 3 character heads, and has 10 points of articulation. Swap the heads out to change up the look of each figure, or interchange any part to create new characters.
Monster figures feature Maniac Morphing to change visual form from scales to fur, or even fire with different colors and heads. Get the Slasher Weapons Pack to add even more attitude to your figures. 
All figures will feature the Glyos joint system. If you're new to Glyos, you may be wondering what that means. 
Glyos Size Chart (Left to Right: Toy Pizza, Battle Tribes, Mighty Maniax, Onell Design, Onell Design, and Spaced Out Design)
The Glyos System features a simple peg & socket joint system known as the "Fit Function" that makes them completely interchangeable with one another, allowing for limitless build options. Created by Onell Design, this unique joint system is only made available to Glyos approved toy makers. Rocom Toys has been working closely with Onell Design to ensure that Mighty Maniax figures fit right into the Glyos world while also maintaining their original voice and attitude.
Mixed parts Glyos build including Mighty Maniax, Toyfinity, and Onell Design pieces.
With Glyos joints, any of the toys shown above can share parts for new character creations. Its almost like LEGO for action figures!
For more insight into the world of Glyos, check out the detailed video above made by The Crafsman.
PLAY

Growing up in the '90s wouldn't be the same without 16-Bit video games played on the Super Nintendo and Sega Genesis systems. When cinematographer, Joel Benner, and video-game coder, Matt Cooper, approached Rocom Toys with the opportunity to make a classic 16-Bit side-scroller, there was no question that it had to be for Mighty Maniax.
Mighty Maniax: The Video Game features 16-Bit Graphics With Modern Gameplay.
What Rocom Toys created is an action-packed, spooky, shoot 'em up with a Contra meets Ghosts 'N Goblins vibe, all to the retro synthwave sounds of All The Damn Vampires. The music created for the game throws you right back into the '80s with the single "Johnny's Revenge."
"Johnny's Revenge" Album Artwork
In the single-level, downloadable-demo, you play as Johnny Tombstone. Travel through creepy graveyards, and haunted forests as you blast away waves of bats, monsters, and possessed tombstones! The ultimate dream is to eventually make an 8-level, full-length video game for the Nintendo Switch, or other consoles. The video game demo comes FREE with every reward including a Mighty Maniax figure.
Death Jaguar Add-On Accessories Stretch Goal
Rocom Toys started in 2018 after the success of the Death Jaguar Vinyl Toy Kickstarter. With hundreds of units sold, we began working with illustrators and artists to develop new toys that are unlike any other. Tom Neely's "Henry & Glenn Forever" Anime Robots, and last year's "Future Me" by Alex Pardee, both got vinyl toy treatments from their own successful Kickstarter campaigns. You can always check in on what we are up to on the Rocom Toys Instagram account @rocomtoys, or the new Mighty Maniax page @mightymaniax. This is our 4th toy campaign and we are hoping that, with your help, it will be another successful one! 
Mutant Soldiers (Photo by Quang Le)
There are a few ways to back this project. Rewards range from a digital download of the Mighty Maniax theme song by All The Damn Vampires to a fully playable single-level demo of Mighty Maniax: The Video Game.
Exclusive Enamel Pin Designed by Tom Whalen
Early bird reward tiers will ship with an exclusive enamel pin designed by Tom Whalen! These are limited items and are only available while supplies last.
Trading Card Artwork(From Left to Right) by Ben Templesmith, Johnny Ryan, Tyler Jacobs, and Patrick Gleason.
Some incredible illustrators have lended their talents to create exclusive Mighty Maniax Artist Edition Trading Cards. Every figure purchased will come with a limited edition mystery card from one of the following artists: Tom Neely, Johnny Ryan, Ben Templesmith, Megan Hutchison Cates, Chloe Rice, Witchhaus, Christopher Ulrich, Bagger43, Tyler Jacobs, Kyle Wlodgya, Ian Ameling, Abraham Lopez, Megan Risk, Kelly Turnbull, or Patrick Gleason. 
Photo by Quang Le
Multiple figure purchases will come with multiple cards. Wave One rewards will ship with the full set of Artist Edition trading cards, and some backers will also have the option to add their name to the video game credits! Backing any amount is very appreciated, and if this project isn't for you, please consider sharing it with a friend that may be interested. 
Reward Add-Ons
Remember, if you don't see a reward combination that suits you, you can now Add-On any items marked in blue in the Add-On section of your Kickstarter Pledge. 
To do this:
Go to the project page
Click on "Manage My Pledge"
You must select your original pledge (scroll down until you find it)
Click on "Pledge x Dollars" (Just like you did the first time)
Now - on the next screen before you check out, here is where you can add on figures and accessory packs.
Kickstarter will also automatically tally up the total cost for you!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This will be Rocom Toys' 4th campaign on Kickstarter. This project has been taken as far as it can go creatively. The main challenges in designing these toys have been accomplished and all that's left to do is raise the money to cover the mold fees. Its no easy task and the greatest challenge in getting these toys made. But, if we can share this project and raise enough money to cover the molds, then we can all enjoy some new figures in the Glyos universe! The risks are minimal once we have the funding to get the toys made. Onell design will be helping every step of the way to get these produced and ready for your collection. The Glyos factory has made countless compatible figures and the production of these toys are in very good hands. Once funding is achieved, these will all go into production immediately and we will update you every step of the way over the following 8 months.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
The music and video game digital assets will be made available to both Mac and PC users. We always want to maximize our audience and the more people that can enjoy the video game the better! 

All figures will have Glyos joints. These joints are extremely durable and can take all of the pops and pulls when rearranging parts to make new Mighty Maniax figures. Unlike standard collectible toys, these are sturdy and won't deteriorate with time. Glyos figures are meant to be as versatile and modular as possible to create many visual combinations. Any Glyos compatible figure can be used with the Mighty Maniax toy line.
Reusability and recyclability
By using digital downloads for our music and game assets, we can avoid creating wasteful, over-designed packaging and plastics to get these rewards out to backers.

All Mighty Maniax figures are packaged with the least amount of material as possible. Each figure ships in a small recyclable, heat-sealed, bag to lower material waste. Flashy packaging gets thrown away eventually. We are doing our best to avoid that.

campaign.story:
We're excited to present new items we've been working on, based on feedback from thousands of customers and Kickstarter backers. 
The campaign is ending today, September 10.
Now's your last chance to get your pledges in!
Orders are planned to ship in three months, about mid-December.
1. Neoprene Playmats to make any flat surface a quality gaming table.
2. Premium Bags for taking several options to game night with great style and protection.
2. Lightweight Bags as a smaller sized option, meant for quick trips or a short night with friends.
4. 2021 Weekly Desk Calendar with 53 beautiful board game photos taken by members of the community.
The Playmat is a premium play surface designed with the help of over a thousand gamers who participated in surveys and provided insightful feedback.
Whether you're a casual or diehard gamer, there's no doubt this will elevate gaming experiences for you and your friends and family, at home or on the go.
Based on survey data, it will come in two sizes:
 3 x 5 ft (91 x 152 cm)
 3.5 x 5.5 ft (107 x 168 cm)
The smaller size will fit on 75% of your tables and the larger size will fit on 45% of your tables. These two options should be a good balance between fitting on as many tables as possible, while giving you as much room to play as possible.
As an added bonus, the small size will fit in the play area of our affordable and available-for-purchase Jasper Board Game Table, and the large size is the same size as the Jasper's dining topper.
Extra Thick Padding
         Our premium Playmat is 5mm thick, a noticeable improvement over typical 3mm options. This makes it closer to a real gaming table feel designed to elevate your tactile experience. It's not just a pretty backdrop.
Inset Edge Stitching
         The edge stitching really takes the Playmat from basic material to a fine product. We've also made sure the stitching has a lower profile than the rest of the mat, so it won't catch cards if they slide to the edge.  
No-Slip Rubber Backing
         Few things are worse than a board sliding across the table and pieces falling to the floor. We've tested this. Trust us. The Playmat won't be sliding anywhere.
Every Playmat will come with a carrying case specifically designed for it. We want it to go with you to a friend's house, a community game night, a con, or a weekend getaway.
I'm always a little skeptical of "gift-with-purchase" items companies use to increase interest, so it was important this wasn't just a cheap add-on. We've made sure the quality of the case matches the quality of the mat. The Playmat slides into the case easily and the adjustable straps make it comfortable to carry. We bet you'll end up using it even more than you think!
Why do I need a board game bag, you ask? We agree you could use a small grocery bag or precariously bungee-cord a big stack of games together - but wouldn't you and your games feel much safer with something made exclusively for them?
When we first launched these bags, we had no idea just how much you'd love them and how important they'd be. From going over to a friend's house or even traveling (yes, this will happen again!), having a durable and padded bag has saved countless boxes getting lost or ruined and pieces exploding all over the floor or car. Now, with a bunch of real-life product testing, the Premium Bag is even better with upgraded shoulder straps and limited-edition colors.
Durable water resistant exterior with reinforced seams 
Rubber feet
Heavy padding on all six sides
Multiple compartments
Tough metal zippers 
Several options for different carrying methods
Different situations (or hand cramps) call for different transport methods, so your new Premium or Standard bag is built for several options.  You can wear it as a backpack, secure it to your luggage, or carry it the good old fashioned way. The backpack straps even hide under the luggage handle slip so that everything is tucked away when you aren't using them.
Premium Bag Bonus: A removable shoulder strap with heavy-duty metal parts and a padded strap.
One of the most popular requests  was to add more colors and we definitely agreed, so here they are: Ruby Red and Fern Green. These are limited edition colors so if you like them, now's the time to get them!
Please note, Heather Blue bags are not available in Europe for this campaign.
You're only as good as your weakest link, so they say. And whoever "they" are, they're probably right.
Which is why we're adding all metal parts to the Premium Bag. Now, the weight capacity has increased and you can be certain that you'll be able to carry any ambitious packing list.
Plus, doesn't metal just look way better, and well, more premium?
Metal parts!
The Premium and Standard Bags are both the same shape, but the main differences are the upgraded materials, colors, carrying options, and weight capacity.
 Fabric & Colors: Premium bags are made with a high-end soft-touch blue, red or green fabric. Standard Bags are made of a basic woven fabric and are only available in grey.
 Carrying Options: Premium bags offer a heavy-duty and removable shoulder strap. 
 Weight Limits: Premium Bags are rated at 65 pounds for every carrying method while the Standard Bag handle is rated at 50 pounds for the handle and the backpack straps at 40 pounds.
**Upgrade: The premium bags have been upgraded from our previous bags. They now have metal clasps and clips instead of plastic.** 
"Chad really listened to his customers and his reviewers and went back to the drawing board and redesigned it and you can tell he is also a game player because he made the perfect game bag. Price point - perfect. The quality - for what it is, for what it does - it's a spot-on perfect."
Sometimes you don't need everything our Premium and Standard bags have to offer, so we're excited to launch a completely new and very affordable companion product, the Lightweight Bag.
It has the solid construction of our Premium and Standard offerings but is a bit smaller.
Folds flat
Dual-layer water resistant fabric exterior
Wraparound handle straps to fully support game boxes
I realized I needed this because grocery bags aren’t built for games. The proportions aren't right for games to fit comfortably, no lid meant everything falling out in the car, there was no protection from light rain, and they weren’t built for the weight.
I also felt it wasn't quite appropriate to bring a big imposing bag when going to dinner with friends and they asked me to bring over "just a couple of games". 
Priced at only $6, its dollar-to-value ratio will definitely impress you!
Note on weight limits: The Premium, Standard and Lightweight bag weight limits are based on factory testing. These bags are made for board games not for bricks, gold bars, or dirty laundry, so please use them responsibly. Weight limits also may vary depending on the weight distribution and how the bag is handled.
Our 2020 Weekly-View Calendar was a huge hit (little did we know how many board games we'd actually end up playing) so we're bringing it back for 2021 with updated photos.
This is a feature-packed calendar that will include weekly gaming prompts, gamer profile cards, full year overview, 10x10 Challenge, weekly tracker, habit tracker, and space for notes.
Have you seen some great board game photos that should be in the calendar? Recommend a specific photo (with link to original photo and/or photographer profile) in the comments section and we'll choose some photos to include! (assuming the photographer is on board).
It's basic business that if you're using someone's work, they should get paid. All photographers will be paid a royalty based on a percentage of calendar sales and will receive a free calendar. Each photo will say the name of both the photographer and game. 
Anytime before your items ship, you may cancel your order for a full refund, no questions asked.
And when you do get your items, if you don't think what you ordered lives up to expectations, we'll also refund you 100% and even pay for return shipping.
We are quite confident you should receive your items by the end of December, before Christmas. There's also the possibility that, depending on your order, our inventory and fulfillment speed, you may receive your items as early as October (We'll caffeinate our elves and try our best!).
No additional duty or taxes will be due when your rewards are delivered to US, Canada, UK & European Union, and Australia locations.
Friendly shipping means your package will ship from your own country or region. This is done to expedite delivery and eliminate taxes and fees.
US Friendly Shipping
EU/UK Friendly Shipping (Will ship from Germany)
Australia Friendly Shipping
Canada Friendly Shipping
Do not manually increase your pledge amount to pay for the shipping now.
Shipping will be collected after the campaign in the Pledge Manager. You will get an email and an update from us after the campaign with instructions for the Pledge Manager. If you pay for shipping now, it will make things much more complicated during the Pledge Manager.
BoardGameTables.com was founded in 2014 by me, Chad DeShon. I'm a gamer who wanted a nice table for playing board games and figured other people might as well.
Now, in addition to selling high quality custom board game tables, BoardGameTables.com also sells a less expensive, some-assembly-required, solid wood table called The Jasper Board Game Table, and a line of quick but deceptively strategic board games.
We started selling board game bags for a similar reason. I needed something to carry my games in. No off-the-shelf options worked for me. They were too big, too small, or not protected enough.
I published a board game calendar back in 2011, simply as a hobby, and sold 100. It was the first time I sold a product online, and it planted a seed of things to come; starting a business that would serve the board gaming community.  It's so rewarding to still be doing that.
First: Choose the pledge level you want.
Second: If you want to buy lightweight bags or calendars, you will need to manually increase the price to pay for those.
Add $6 to your pledge for every lightweight bag.
Add $14 to your pledge for every calendar.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Even though this Kickstarter consists of several different products, I am confident we can deliver them on time. Of course international shipping and COVID bring a certain amount of uncertainty to any project, but we have done our best to prepare and add extra padding to the schedule to account for this.

All the product designs are final (except we are still choosing some calendar photos, so send suggestions). The bags and calendars are made by factories we have used before. We are using fulfillment centers that we have used for previous Kickstarter projects.

Hey everyone,
Three quick things here.
Account Name Change
We’re going to be switching our Kickstarter account name from “Chad DeShon” to “BoardGameTables.com”. Chad is still the owner, and everything business related is the same, we just think it makes a bit more sense for the Kickstarter account to be named after the company.

Europe

We're sending the last products out for delivery now and hope you'll get them soon!

If you don't live in Europe
Everything has shipped and should have been delivered, or will be very soon!

We still have 183 rewards to deliver to European backers.
Because of new COVID restrictions, we are not able to ship DHL packages with any side over 40cm from our fulfillment center in Germany to Ireland, Czech Republic, Belgium, Italy, Greece or the UK. We are not able to ship any packages to France.
What does 40cm have to do with COVID? Well, they didn't really tell us. But I think it has to do with capacity. COVID precautions mean work is getting done slower. Ecommerce and holiday craziness means more packages are being shipped now than ever before. Large packages take more work to ship. So this is a way to throttle the crazy.

The original Kickstarter estimate for this campaign was December 2020. We are still on target for that except for a few European backers who ordered red bags.
United States
Everything has shipped and has had enough time to get to you. The only exception to this is people who filled out their pledge manager late and ordered a small playmat. Those orders shipped out today.
